  50 dnl PKG_PREREQ(MIN-VERSION)
  51 dnl -----------------------
  52 dnl Since: 0.29
  53 dnl
  54 dnl Verify that the version of the pkg-config macros are at least
  55 dnl MIN-VERSION. Unlike PKG_PROG_PKG_CONFIG, which checks the user's
  56 dnl installed version of pkg-config, this checks the developer's version
  57 dnl of pkg.m4 when generating configure.
  58 dnl
  59 dnl To ensure that this macro is defined, also add:
  60 dnl m4_ifndef([PKG_PREREQ],
  61 dnl     [m4_fatal([must install pkg-config 0.29 or later before running autoconf/autogen])])
  62 dnl
  63 dnl See the "Since" comment for each macro you use to see what version
  64 dnl of the macros you require.
  65 m4_defun([PKG_PREREQ],
  66 [m4_define([PKG_MACROS_VERSION], [0.29.1])
  67 m4_if(m4_version_compare(PKG_MACROS_VERSION, [$1]), -1,
  68     [m4_fatal([pkg.m4 version $1 or higher is required but ]PKG_MACROS_VERSION[ found])])
  69 ])dnl PKG_PREREQ
  70 
  71 dnl PKG_PROG_PKG_CONFIG([MIN-VERSION])
  72 dnl ----------------------------------
  73 dnl Since: 0.16
  74 dnl
  75 dnl Search for the pkg-config tool and set the PKG_CONFIG variable to
  76 dnl first found in the path. Checks that the version of pkg-config found
  77 dnl is at least MIN-VERSION. If MIN-VERSION is not specified, 0.9.0 is
  78 dnl used since that's the first version where most current features of
  79 dnl pkg-config existed.
  80 AC_DEFUN([PKG_PROG_PKG_CONFIG],
  81 [m4_pattern_forbid([^_?PKG_[A-Z_]+$])
  82 m4_pattern_allow([^PKG_CONFIG(_(PATH|LIBDIR|SYSROOT_DIR|ALLOW_SYSTEM_(CFLAGS|LIBS)))?$])
  83 m4_pattern_allow([^PKG_CONFIG_(DISABLE_UNINSTALLED|TOP_BUILD_DIR|DEBUG_SPEW)$])
  84 AC_ARG_VAR([PKG_CONFIG], [path to pkg-config utility])
  85 AC_ARG_VAR([PKG_CONFIG_PATH], [directories to add to pkg-config's search path])
  86 AC_ARG_VAR([PKG_CONFIG_LIBDIR], [path overriding pkg-config's built-in search path])
  87 
  88 if test "x$ac_cv_env_PKG_CONFIG_set" != "xset"; then
  89 	AC_PATH_TOOL([PKG_CONFIG], [pkg-config])
  90 fi
  91 if test -n "$PKG_CONFIG"; then
  92 	_pkg_min_version=m4_default([$1], [0.9.0])
  93 	AC_MSG_CHECKING([pkg-config is at least version $_pkg_min_version])
  94 	if $PKG_CONFIG --atleast-pkgconfig-version $_pkg_min_version; then
  95 		AC_MSG_RESULT([yes])
  96 	else
  97 		AC_MSG_RESULT([no])
  98 		PKG_CONFIG=""
  99 	fi
 100 fi[]dnl
 101 ])dnl PKG_PROG_PKG_CONFIG
 102 
 103 dnl PKG_CHECK_EXISTS(MODULES, [ACTION-IF-FOUND], [ACTION-IF-NOT-FOUND])
 104 dnl -------------------------------------------------------------------
 105 dnl Since: 0.18
 106 dnl
 107 dnl Check to see whether a particular set of modules exists. Similar to
 108 dnl PKG_CHECK_MODULES(), but does not set variables or print errors.
 109 dnl
 110 dnl Please remember that m4 expands AC_REQUIRE([PKG_PROG_PKG_CONFIG])
 111 dnl only at the first occurence in configure.ac, so if the first place
 112 dnl it's called might be skipped (such as if it is within an "if", you
 113 dnl have to call PKG_CHECK_EXISTS manually
 114 AC_DEFUN([PKG_CHECK_EXISTS],
 115 [AC_REQUIRE([PKG_PROG_PKG_CONFIG])dnl
 116 if test -n "$PKG_CONFIG" && \
 117     AC_RUN_LOG([$PKG_CONFIG --exists --print-errors "$1"]); then
 118   m4_default([$2], [:])
 119 m4_ifvaln([$3], [else
 120   $3])dnl
 121 fi])
 122 
 123 dnl _PKG_CONFIG([VARIABLE], [COMMAND], [MODULES])
 124 dnl ---------------------------------------------
 125 dnl Internal wrapper calling pkg-config via PKG_CONFIG and setting
 126 dnl pkg_failed based on the result.
 127 m4_define([_PKG_CONFIG],
 128 [if test -n "$$1"; then
 129     pkg_cv_[]$1="$$1"
 130  elif test -n "$PKG_CONFIG"; then
 131     PKG_CHECK_EXISTS([$3],
 132                      [pkg_cv_[]$1=`$PKG_CONFIG --[]$2 "$3" 2>/dev/null`
 133 		      test "x$?" != "x0" && pkg_failed=yes ],
 134 		     [pkg_failed=yes])
 135  else
 136     pkg_failed=untried
 137 fi[]dnl
 138 ])dnl _PKG_CONFIG
 139 
 140 dnl _PKG_SHORT_ERRORS_SUPPORTED
 141 dnl ---------------------------
 142 dnl Internal check to see if pkg-config supports short errors.
 143 AC_DEFUN([_PKG_SHORT_ERRORS_SUPPORTED],
 144 [AC_REQUIRE([PKG_PROG_PKG_CONFIG])
 145 if $PKG_CONFIG --atleast-pkgconfig-version 0.20; then
 146         _pkg_short_errors_supported=yes
 147 else
 148         _pkg_short_errors_supported=no
 149 fi[]dnl
 150 ])dnl _PKG_SHORT_ERRORS_SUPPORTED
 151 
 152 
 153 dnl PKG_CHECK_MODULES(VARIABLE-PREFIX, MODULES, [ACTION-IF-FOUND],
 154 dnl   [ACTION-IF-NOT-FOUND])
 155 dnl --------------------------------------------------------------
 156 dnl Since: 0.4.0
 157 dnl
 158 dnl Note that if there is a possibility the first call to
 159 dnl PKG_CHECK_MODULES might not happen, you should be sure to include an
 160 dnl explicit call to PKG_PROG_PKG_CONFIG in your configure.ac
 161 AC_DEFUN([PKG_CHECK_MODULES],
 162 [AC_REQUIRE([PKG_PROG_PKG_CONFIG])dnl
 163 AC_ARG_VAR([$1][_CFLAGS], [C compiler flags for $1, overriding pkg-config])dnl
 164 AC_ARG_VAR([$1][_LIBS], [linker flags for $1, overriding pkg-config])dnl
 165 
 166 pkg_failed=no
 167 AC_MSG_CHECKING([for $1])
 168 
 169 _PKG_CONFIG([$1][_CFLAGS], [cflags], [$2])
 170 _PKG_CONFIG([$1][_LIBS], [libs], [$2])
 171 
 172 m4_define([_PKG_TEXT], [Alternatively, you may set the environment variables $1[]_CFLAGS
 173 and $1[]_LIBS to avoid the need to call pkg-config.
 174 See the pkg-config man page for more details.])
 175 
 176 if test $pkg_failed = yes; then
 177         AC_MSG_RESULT([no])
 178         _PKG_SHORT_ERRORS_SUPPORTED
 179         if test $_pkg_short_errors_supported = yes; then
 180 	        $1[]_PKG_ERRORS=`$PKG_CONFIG --short-errors --print-errors --cflags --libs "$2" 2>&1`
 181         else
 182 	        $1[]_PKG_ERRORS=`$PKG_CONFIG --print-errors --cflags --libs "$2" 2>&1`
 183         fi
 184 	# Put the nasty error message in config.log where it belongs
 185 	echo "$$1[]_PKG_ERRORS" >&AS_MESSAGE_LOG_FD
 186 
 187 	m4_default([$4], [AC_MSG_ERROR(
 188 [Package requirements ($2) were not met:
 189 
 190 $$1_PKG_ERRORS
 191 
 192 Consider adjusting the PKG_CONFIG_PATH environment variable if you
 193 installed software in a non-standard prefix.
 194 
 195 _PKG_TEXT])[]dnl
 196         ])
 197 elif test $pkg_failed = untried; then
 198         AC_MSG_RESULT([no])
 199 	m4_default([$4], [AC_MSG_FAILURE(
 200 [The pkg-config script could not be found or is too old.  Make sure it
 201 is in your PATH or set the PKG_CONFIG environment variable to the full
 202 path to pkg-config.
 203 
 204 _PKG_TEXT
 205 
 206 To get pkg-config, see <http://pkg-config.freedesktop.org/>.])[]dnl
 207         ])
 208 else
 209 	$1[]_CFLAGS=$pkg_cv_[]$1[]_CFLAGS
 210 	$1[]_LIBS=$pkg_cv_[]$1[]_LIBS
 211         AC_MSG_RESULT([yes])
 212 	$3
 213 fi[]dnl
 214 ])dnl PKG_CHECK_MODULES
 215 
 216 
 217 dnl PKG_CHECK_MODULES_STATIC(VARIABLE-PREFIX, MODULES, [ACTION-IF-FOUND],
 218 dnl   [ACTION-IF-NOT-FOUND])
 219 dnl ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 220 dnl Since: 0.29
 221 dnl
 222 dnl Checks for existence of MODULES and gathers its build flags with
 223 dnl static libraries enabled. Sets VARIABLE-PREFIX_CFLAGS from --cflags
 224 dnl and VARIABLE-PREFIX_LIBS from --libs.
 225 dnl
 226 dnl Note that if there is a possibility the first call to
 227 dnl PKG_CHECK_MODULES_STATIC might not happen, you should be sure to
 228 dnl include an explicit call to PKG_PROG_PKG_CONFIG in your
 229 dnl configure.ac.
 230 AC_DEFUN([PKG_CHECK_MODULES_STATIC],
 231 [AC_REQUIRE([PKG_PROG_PKG_CONFIG])dnl
 232 _save_PKG_CONFIG=$PKG_CONFIG
 233 PKG_CONFIG="$PKG_CONFIG --static"
 234 PKG_CHECK_MODULES($@)
 235 PKG_CONFIG=$_save_PKG_CONFIG[]dnl
 236 ])dnl PKG_CHECK_MODULES_STATIC

 239 dnl PKG_INSTALLDIR([DIRECTORY])
 240 dnl -------------------------
 241 dnl Since: 0.27
 242 dnl
 243 dnl Substitutes the variable pkgconfigdir as the location where a module
 244 dnl should install pkg-config .pc files. By default the directory is
 245 dnl $libdir/pkgconfig, but the default can be changed by passing
 246 dnl DIRECTORY. The user can override through the --with-pkgconfigdir
 247 dnl parameter.
 248 AC_DEFUN([PKG_INSTALLDIR],
 249 [m4_pushdef([pkg_default], [m4_default([$1], ['${libdir}/pkgconfig'])])
 250 m4_pushdef([pkg_description],
 251     [pkg-config installation directory @<:@]pkg_default[@:>@])
 252 AC_ARG_WITH([pkgconfigdir],
 253     [AS_HELP_STRING([--with-pkgconfigdir], pkg_description)],,
 254     [with_pkgconfigdir=]pkg_default)
 255 AC_SUBST([pkgconfigdir], [$with_pkgconfigdir])
 256 m4_popdef([pkg_default])
 257 m4_popdef([pkg_description])
 258 ])dnl PKG_INSTALLDIR
 259 
 260 
 261 dnl PKG_NOARCH_INSTALLDIR([DIRECTORY])
 262 dnl --------------------------------
 263 dnl Since: 0.27
 264 dnl
 265 dnl Substitutes the variable noarch_pkgconfigdir as the location where a
 266 dnl module should install arch-independent pkg-config .pc files. By
 267 dnl default the directory is $datadir/pkgconfig, but the default can be
 268 dnl changed by passing DIRECTORY. The user can override through the
 269 dnl --with-noarch-pkgconfigdir parameter.
 270 AC_DEFUN([PKG_NOARCH_INSTALLDIR],
 271 [m4_pushdef([pkg_default], [m4_default([$1], ['${datadir}/pkgconfig'])])
 272 m4_pushdef([pkg_description],
 273     [pkg-config arch-independent installation directory @<:@]pkg_default[@:>@])
 274 AC_ARG_WITH([noarch-pkgconfigdir],
 275     [AS_HELP_STRING([--with-noarch-pkgconfigdir], pkg_description)],,
 276     [with_noarch_pkgconfigdir=]pkg_default)
 277 AC_SUBST([noarch_pkgconfigdir], [$with_noarch_pkgconfigdir])
 278 m4_popdef([pkg_default])
 279 m4_popdef([pkg_description])
 280 ])dnl PKG_NOARCH_INSTALLDIR
 281 
 282 
 283 dnl PKG_CHECK_VAR(VARIABLE, MODULE, CONFIG-VARIABLE,
 284 dnl [ACTION-IF-FOUND], [ACTION-IF-NOT-FOUND])
 285 dnl -------------------------------------------
 286 dnl Since: 0.28
 287 dnl
 288 dnl Retrieves the value of the pkg-config variable for the given module.
 289 AC_DEFUN([PKG_CHECK_VAR],
 290 [AC_REQUIRE([PKG_PROG_PKG_CONFIG])dnl
 291 AC_ARG_VAR([$1], [value of $3 for $2, overriding pkg-config])dnl
 292 
 293 _PKG_CONFIG([$1], [variable="][$3]["], [$2])
 294 AS_VAR_COPY([$1], [pkg_cv_][$1])
 295 
 296 AS_VAR_IF([$1], [""], [$5], [$4])dnl
 297 ])dnl PKG_CHECK_VAR

 299 dnl PKG_WITH_MODULES(VARIABLE-PREFIX, MODULES,
 300 dnl   [ACTION-IF-FOUND],[ACTION-IF-NOT-FOUND],
 301 dnl   [DESCRIPTION], [DEFAULT])
 302 dnl ------------------------------------------
 303 dnl
 304 dnl Prepare a "--with-" configure option using the lowercase
 305 dnl [VARIABLE-PREFIX] name, merging the behaviour of AC_ARG_WITH and
 306 dnl PKG_CHECK_MODULES in a single macro.
 307 AC_DEFUN([PKG_WITH_MODULES],
 308 [
 309 m4_pushdef([with_arg], m4_tolower([$1]))
 310 
 311 m4_pushdef([description],
 312            [m4_default([$5], [build with ]with_arg[ support])])
 313 
 314 m4_pushdef([def_arg], [m4_default([$6], [auto])])
 315 m4_pushdef([def_action_if_found], [AS_TR_SH([with_]with_arg)=yes])
 316 m4_pushdef([def_action_if_not_found], [AS_TR_SH([with_]with_arg)=no])
 317 
 318 m4_case(def_arg,
 319             [yes],[m4_pushdef([with_without], [--without-]with_arg)],
 320             [m4_pushdef([with_without],[--with-]with_arg)])
 321 
 322 AC_ARG_WITH(with_arg,
 323      AS_HELP_STRING(with_without, description[ @<:@default=]def_arg[@:>@]),,
 324     [AS_TR_SH([with_]with_arg)=def_arg])
 325 
 326 AS_CASE([$AS_TR_SH([with_]with_arg)],
 327             [yes],[PKG_CHECK_MODULES([$1],[$2],$3,$4)],
 328             [auto],[PKG_CHECK_MODULES([$1],[$2],
 329                                         [m4_n([def_action_if_found]) $3],
 330                                         [m4_n([def_action_if_not_found]) $4])])
 331 
 332 m4_popdef([with_arg])
 333 m4_popdef([description])
 334 m4_popdef([def_arg])
 335 
 336 ])dnl PKG_WITH_MODULES
 337 
 338 dnl PKG_HAVE_WITH_MODULES(VARIABLE-PREFIX, MODULES,
 339 dnl   [DESCRIPTION], [DEFAULT])
 340 dnl -----------------------------------------------
 341 dnl
 342 dnl Convenience macro to trigger AM_CONDITIONAL after PKG_WITH_MODULES
 343 dnl check._[VARIABLE-PREFIX] is exported as make variable.
 344 AC_DEFUN([PKG_HAVE_WITH_MODULES],
 345 [
 346 PKG_WITH_MODULES([$1],[$2],,,[$3],[$4])
 347 
 348 AM_CONDITIONAL([HAVE_][$1],
 349                [test "$AS_TR_SH([with_]m4_tolower([$1]))" = "yes"])
 350 ])dnl PKG_HAVE_WITH_MODULES
 351 
 352 dnl PKG_HAVE_DEFINE_WITH_MODULES(VARIABLE-PREFIX, MODULES,
 353 dnl   [DESCRIPTION], [DEFAULT])
 354 dnl ------------------------------------------------------
 355 dnl
 356 dnl Convenience macro to run AM_CONDITIONAL and AC_DEFINE after
 357 dnl PKG_WITH_MODULES check. HAVE_[VARIABLE-PREFIX] is exported as make
 358 dnl and preprocessor variable.
 359 AC_DEFUN([PKG_HAVE_DEFINE_WITH_MODULES],
 360 [
 361 PKG_HAVE_WITH_MODULES([$1],[$2],[$3],[$4])
 362 
 363 AS_IF([test "$AS_TR_SH([with_]m4_tolower([$1]))" = "yes"],
 364         [AC_DEFINE([HAVE_][$1], 1, [Enable ]m4_tolower([$1])[ support])])
 365 ])dnl PKG_HAVE_DEFINE_WITH_MODULES
 366

 373 # AM_AUTOMAKE_VERSION(VERSION)
 374 # ----------------------------
 375 # Automake X.Y traces this macro to ensure aclocal.m4 has been
 376 # generated from the m4 files accompanying Automake X.Y.
 377 # (This private macro should not be called outside this file.)
 378 AC_DEFUN([AM_AUTOMAKE_VERSION],
 379 [am__api_version='1.16'
 380 dnl Some users find AM_AUTOMAKE_VERSION and mistake it for a way to
 381 dnl require some minimum version.  Point them to the right macro.
 382 m4_if([$1], [1.16.1], [],
 383       [AC_FATAL([Do not call $0, use AM_INIT_AUTOMAKE([$1]).])])dnl

 386 # _AM_AUTOCONF_VERSION(VERSION)
 387 # -----------------------------
 388 # aclocal traces this macro to find the Autoconf version.
 389 # This is a private macro too.  Using m4_define simplifies
 390 # the logic in aclocal, which can simply ignore this definition.
 391 m4_define([_AM_AUTOCONF_VERSION], [])

 393 # AM_SET_CURRENT_AUTOMAKE_VERSION
 394 # -------------------------------
 395 # Call AM_AUTOMAKE_VERSION and AM_AUTOMAKE_VERSION so they can be traced.
 396 # This function is AC_REQUIREd by AM_INIT_AUTOMAKE.
 397 AC_DEFUN([AM_SET_CURRENT_AUTOMAKE_VERSION],
 398 [AM_AUTOMAKE_VERSION([1.16.1])dnl
 399 m4_ifndef([AC_AUTOCONF_VERSION],
 400   [m4_copy([m4_PACKAGE_VERSION], [AC_AUTOCONF_VERSION])])dnl
 401 _AM_AUTOCONF_VERSION(m4_defn([AC_AUTOCONF_VERSION]))])

 403 # AM_AUX_DIR_EXPAND                                         -*- Autoconf -*-
 404 
 405 # Copyright (C) 2001-2018 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
 406 #
 407 # This file is free software; the Free Software Foundation
 408 # gives unlimited permission to copy and/or distribute it,
 409 # with or without modifications, as long as this notice is preserved.
 410 
 411 # For projects using AC_CONFIG_AUX_DIR([foo]), Autoconf sets
 412 # $ac_aux_dir to '$srcdir/foo'.  In other projects, it is set to
 413 # '$srcdir', '$srcdir/..', or '$srcdir/../..'.
 414 #
 415 # Of course, Automake must honor this variable whenever it calls a
 416 # tool from the auxiliary directory.  The problem is that $srcdir (and
 417 # therefore $ac_aux_dir as well) can be either absolute or relative,
 418 # depending on how configure is run.  This is pretty annoying, since
 419 # it makes $ac_aux_dir quite unusable in subdirectories: in the top
 420 # source directory, any form will work fine, but in subdirectories a
 421 # relative path needs to be adjusted first.
 422 #
 423 # $ac_aux_dir/missing
 424 #    fails when called from a subdirectory if $ac_aux_dir is relative
 425 # $top_srcdir/$ac_aux_dir/missing
 426 #    fails if $ac_aux_dir is absolute,
 427 #    fails when called from a subdirectory in a VPATH build with
 428 #          a relative $ac_aux_dir
 429 #
 430 # The reason of the latter failure is that $top_srcdir and $ac_aux_dir
 431 # are both prefixed by $srcdir.  In an in-source build this is usually
 432 # harmless because $srcdir is '.', but things will broke when you
 433 # start a VPATH build or use an absolute $srcdir.
 434 #
 435 # So we could use something similar to $top_srcdir/$ac_aux_dir/missing,
 436 # iff we strip the leading $srcdir from $ac_aux_dir.  That would be:
 437 #   am_aux_dir='\$(top_srcdir)/'`expr "$ac_aux_dir" : "$srcdir//*\(.*\)"`
 438 # and then we would define $MISSING as
 439 #   MISSING="\${SHELL} $am_aux_dir/missing"
 440 # This will work as long as MISSING is not called from configure, because
 441 # unfortunately $(top_srcdir) has no meaning in configure.
 442 # However there are other variables, like CC, which are often used in
 443 # configure, and could therefore not use this "fixed" $ac_aux_dir.
 444 #
 445 # Another solution, used here, is to always expand $ac_aux_dir to an
 446 # absolute PATH.  The drawback is that using absolute paths prevent a
 447 # configured tree to be moved without reconfiguration.
 448 
 449 AC_DEFUN([AM_AUX_DIR_EXPAND],
 450 [AC_REQUIRE([AC_CONFIG_AUX_DIR_DEFAULT])dnl
 451 # Expand $ac_aux_dir to an absolute path.
 452 am_aux_dir=`cd "$ac_aux_dir" && pwd`
 453 ])
 454 
 455 # AM_CONDITIONAL                                            -*- Autoconf -*-
 456 
 457 # Copyright (C) 1997-2018 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
 458 #
 459 # This file is free software; the Free Software Foundation
 460 # gives unlimited permission to copy and/or distribute it,
 461 # with or without modifications, as long as this notice is preserved.
 462 
 463 # AM_CONDITIONAL(NAME, SHELL-CONDITION)
 464 # -------------------------------------
 465 # Define a conditional.
 466 AC_DEFUN([AM_CONDITIONAL],
 467 [AC_PREREQ([2.52])dnl
 468  m4_if([$1], [TRUE],  [AC_FATAL([$0: invalid condition: $1])],
 469        [$1], [FALSE], [AC_FATAL([$0: invalid condition: $1])])dnl
 470 AC_SUBST([$1_TRUE])dnl
 471 AC_SUBST([$1_FALSE])dnl
 472 _AM_SUBST_NOTMAKE([$1_TRUE])dnl
 473 _AM_SUBST_NOTMAKE([$1_FALSE])dnl
 474 m4_define([_AM_COND_VALUE_$1], [$2])dnl
 475 if $2; then
 476   $1_TRUE=
 477   $1_FALSE='#'
 478 else
 479   $1_TRUE='#'
 480   $1_FALSE=
 481 fi
 482 AC_CONFIG_COMMANDS_PRE(
 483 [if test -z "${$1_TRUE}" && test -z "${$1_FALSE}"; then
 484   AC_MSG_ERROR([[conditional "$1" was never defined.
 485 Usually this means the macro was only invoked conditionally.]])
 486 fi])])
 487 
 488 # Copyright (C) 1999-2018 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
 489 #
 490 # This file is free software; the Free Software Foundation
 491 # gives unlimited permission to copy and/or distribute it,
 492 # with or without modifications, as long as this notice is preserved.
 493 
 494 
 495 # There are a few dirty hacks below to avoid letting 'AC_PROG_CC' be
 496 # written in clear, in which case automake, when reading aclocal.m4,
 497 # will think it sees a *use*, and therefore will trigger all it's
 498 # C support machinery.  Also note that it means that autoscan, seeing
 499 # CC etc. in the Makefile, will ask for an AC_PROG_CC use...
 500 
 501 
 502 # _AM_DEPENDENCIES(NAME)
 503 # ----------------------
 504 # See how the compiler implements dependency checking.
 505 # NAME is "CC", "CXX", "OBJC", "OBJCXX", "UPC", or "GJC".
 506 # We try a few techniques and use that to set a single cache variable.
 507 #
 508 # We don't AC_REQUIRE the corresponding AC_PROG_CC since the latter was
 509 # modified to invoke _AM_DEPENDENCIES(CC); we would have a circular
 510 # dependency, and given that the user is not expected to run this macro,
 511 # just rely on AC_PROG_CC.
 512 AC_DEFUN([_AM_DEPENDENCIES],
 513 [AC_REQUIRE([AM_SET_DEPDIR])dnl
 514 AC_REQUIRE([AM_OUTPUT_DEPENDENCY_COMMANDS])dnl
 515 AC_REQUIRE([AM_MAKE_INCLUDE])dnl
 516 AC_REQUIRE([AM_DEP_TRACK])dnl
 517 
 518 m4_if([$1], [CC],   [depcc="$CC"   am_compiler_list=],
 519       [$1], [CXX],  [depcc="$CXX"  am_compiler_list=],
 520       [$1], [OBJC], [depcc="$OBJC" am_compiler_list='gcc3 gcc'],
 521       [$1], [OBJCXX], [depcc="$OBJCXX" am_compiler_list='gcc3 gcc'],
 522       [$1], [UPC],  [depcc="$UPC"  am_compiler_list=],
 523       [$1], [GCJ],  [depcc="$GCJ"  am_compiler_list='gcc3 gcc'],
 524                     [depcc="$$1"   am_compiler_list=])
 525 
 526 AC_CACHE_CHECK([dependency style of $depcc],
 527                [am_cv_$1_dependencies_compiler_type],
 528 [if test -z "$AMDEP_TRUE" && test -f "$am_depcomp"; then
 529   # We make a subdir and do the tests there.  Otherwise we can end up
 530   # making bogus files that we don't know about and never remove.  For
 531   # instance it was reported that on HP-UX the gcc test will end up
 532   # making a dummy file named 'D' -- because '-MD' means "put the output
 533   # in D".
 534   rm -rf conftest.dir
 535   mkdir conftest.dir
 536   # Copy depcomp to subdir because otherwise we won't find it if we're
 537   # using a relative directory.
 538   cp "$am_depcomp" conftest.dir
 539   cd conftest.dir
 540   # We will build objects and dependencies in a subdirectory because
 541   # it helps to detect inapplicable dependency modes.  For instance
 542   # both Tru64's cc and ICC support -MD to output dependencies as a
 543   # side effect of compilation, but ICC will put the dependencies in
 544   # the current directory while Tru64 will put them in the object
 545   # directory.
 546   mkdir sub
 547 
 548   am_cv_$1_dependencies_compiler_type=none
 549   if test "$am_compiler_list" = ""; then
 550      am_compiler_list=`sed -n ['s/^#*\([a-zA-Z0-9]*\))$/\1/p'] < ./depcomp`
 551   fi
 552   am__universal=false
 553   m4_case([$1], [CC],
 554     [case " $depcc " in #(
 555      *\ -arch\ *\ -arch\ *) am__universal=true ;;
 556      esac],
 557     [CXX],
 558     [case " $depcc " in #(
 559      *\ -arch\ *\ -arch\ *) am__universal=true ;;
 560      esac])
 561 
 562   for depmode in $am_compiler_list; do
 563     # Setup a source with many dependencies, because some compilers
 564     # like to wrap large dependency lists on column 80 (with \), and
 565     # we should not choose a depcomp mode which is confused by this.
 566     #
 567     # We need to recreate these files for each test, as the compiler may
 568     # overwrite some of them when testing with obscure command lines.
 569     # This happens at least with the AIX C compiler.
 570     : > sub/conftest.c
 571     for i in 1 2 3 4 5 6; do
 572       echo '#include "conftst'$i'.h"' >> sub/conftest.c
 573       # Using ": > sub/conftst$i.h" creates only sub/conftst1.h with
 574       # Solaris 10 /bin/sh.
 575       echo '/* dummy */' > sub/conftst$i.h
 576     done
 577     echo "${am__include} ${am__quote}sub/conftest.Po${am__quote}" > confmf
 578 
 579     # We check with '-c' and '-o' for the sake of the "dashmstdout"
 580     # mode.  It turns out that the SunPro C++ compiler does not properly
 581     # handle '-M -o', and we need to detect this.  Also, some Intel
 582     # versions had trouble with output in subdirs.
 583     am__obj=sub/conftest.${OBJEXT-o}
 584     am__minus_obj="-o $am__obj"
 585     case $depmode in
 586     gcc)
 587       # This depmode causes a compiler race in universal mode.
 588       test "$am__universal" = false || continue
 589       ;;
 590     nosideeffect)
 591       # After this tag, mechanisms are not by side-effect, so they'll
 592       # only be used when explicitly requested.
 593       if test "x$enable_dependency_tracking" = xyes; then
 594 	continue
 595       else
 596 	break
 597       fi
 598       ;;
 599     msvc7 | msvc7msys | msvisualcpp | msvcmsys)
 600       # This compiler won't grok '-c -o', but also, the minuso test has
 601       # not run yet.  These depmodes are late enough in the game, and
 602       # so weak that their functioning should not be impacted.
 603       am__obj=conftest.${OBJEXT-o}
 604       am__minus_obj=
 605       ;;
 606     none) break ;;
 607     esac
 608     if depmode=$depmode \
 609        source=sub/conftest.c object=$am__obj \
 610        depfile=sub/conftest.Po tmpdepfile=sub/conftest.TPo \
 611        $SHELL ./depcomp $depcc -c $am__minus_obj sub/conftest.c \
 612          >/dev/null 2>conftest.err &&
 613        grep sub/conftst1.h sub/conftest.Po > /dev/null 2>&1 &&
 614        grep sub/conftst6.h sub/conftest.Po > /dev/null 2>&1 &&
 615        grep $am__obj sub/conftest.Po > /dev/null 2>&1 &&
 616        ${MAKE-make} -s -f confmf > /dev/null 2>&1; then
 617       # icc doesn't choke on unknown options, it will just issue warnings
 618       # or remarks (even with -Werror).  So we grep stderr for any message
 619       # that says an option was ignored or not supported.
 620       # When given -MP, icc 7.0 and 7.1 complain thusly:
 621       #   icc: Command line warning: ignoring option '-M'; no argument required
 622       # The diagnosis changed in icc 8.0:
 623       #   icc: Command line remark: option '-MP' not supported
 624       if (grep 'ignoring option' conftest.err ||
 625           grep 'not supported' conftest.err) >/dev/null 2>&1; then :; else
 626         am_cv_$1_dependencies_compiler_type=$depmode
 627         break
 628       fi
 629     fi
 630   done
 631 
 632   cd ..
 633   rm -rf conftest.dir
 634 else
 635   am_cv_$1_dependencies_compiler_type=none
 636 fi
 637 ])
 638 AC_SUBST([$1DEPMODE], [depmode=$am_cv_$1_dependencies_compiler_type])
 639 AM_CONDITIONAL([am__fastdep$1], [
 640   test "x$enable_dependency_tracking" != xno \
 641   && test "$am_cv_$1_dependencies_compiler_type" = gcc3])
 642 ])
 643 
 644 
 645 # AM_SET_DEPDIR
 646 # -------------
 647 # Choose a directory name for dependency files.
 648 # This macro is AC_REQUIREd in _AM_DEPENDENCIES.
 649 AC_DEFUN([AM_SET_DEPDIR],
 650 [AC_REQUIRE([AM_SET_LEADING_DOT])dnl
 651 AC_SUBST([DEPDIR], ["${am__leading_dot}deps"])dnl
 652 ])

 655 # AM_DEP_TRACK
 656 # ------------
 657 AC_DEFUN([AM_DEP_TRACK],
 658 [AC_ARG_ENABLE([dependency-tracking], [dnl
 659 AS_HELP_STRING(
 660   [--enable-dependency-tracking],
 661   [do not reject slow dependency extractors])
 662 AS_HELP_STRING(
 663   [--disable-dependency-tracking],
 664   [speeds up one-time build])])
 665 if test "x$enable_dependency_tracking" != xno; then
 666   am_depcomp="$ac_aux_dir/depcomp"
 667   AMDEPBACKSLASH='\'
 668   am__nodep='_no'
 669 fi
 670 AM_CONDITIONAL([AMDEP], [test "x$enable_dependency_tracking" != xno])
 671 AC_SUBST([AMDEPBACKSLASH])dnl
 672 _AM_SUBST_NOTMAKE([AMDEPBACKSLASH])dnl
 673 AC_SUBST([am__nodep])dnl
 674 _AM_SUBST_NOTMAKE([am__nodep])dnl
 675 ])

 677 # Generate code to set up dependency tracking.              -*- Autoconf -*-
 678 
 679 # Copyright (C) 1999-2018 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
 680 #
 681 # This file is free software; the Free Software Foundation
 682 # gives unlimited permission to copy and/or distribute it,
 683 # with or without modifications, as long as this notice is preserved.
 684 
 685 # _AM_OUTPUT_DEPENDENCY_COMMANDS
 686 # ------------------------------
 687 AC_DEFUN([_AM_OUTPUT_DEPENDENCY_COMMANDS],
 688 [{
 689   # Older Autoconf quotes --file arguments for eval, but not when files
 690   # are listed without --file.  Let's play safe and only enable the eval
 691   # if we detect the quoting.
 692   # TODO: see whether this extra hack can be removed once we start
 693   # requiring Autoconf 2.70 or later.
 694   AS_CASE([$CONFIG_FILES],
 695           [*\'*], [eval set x "$CONFIG_FILES"],
 696           [*], [set x $CONFIG_FILES])
 697   shift
 698   # Used to flag and report bootstrapping failures.
 699   am_rc=0
 700   for am_mf
 701   do
 702     # Strip MF so we end up with the name of the file.
 703     am_mf=`AS_ECHO(["$am_mf"]) | sed -e 's/:.*$//'`
 704     # Check whether this is an Automake generated Makefile which includes
 705     # dependency-tracking related rules and includes.
 706     # Grep'ing the whole file directly is not great: AIX grep has a line
 707     # limit of 2048, but all sed's we know have understand at least 4000.
 708     sed -n 's,^am--depfiles:.*,X,p' "$am_mf" | grep X >/dev/null 2>&1 \
 709       || continue
 710     am_dirpart=`AS_DIRNAME(["$am_mf"])`
 711     am_filepart=`AS_BASENAME(["$am_mf"])`
 712     AM_RUN_LOG([cd "$am_dirpart" \
 713       && sed -e '/# am--include-marker/d' "$am_filepart" \
 714         | $MAKE -f - am--depfiles]) || am_rc=$?
 715   done
 716   if test $am_rc -ne 0; then
 717     AC_MSG_FAILURE([Something went wrong bootstrapping makefile fragments
 718     for automatic dependency tracking.  Try re-running configure with the
 719     '--disable-dependency-tracking' option to at least be able to build
 720     the package (albeit without support for automatic dependency tracking).])
 721   fi
 722   AS_UNSET([am_dirpart])
 723   AS_UNSET([am_filepart])
 724   AS_UNSET([am_mf])
 725   AS_UNSET([am_rc])
 726   rm -f conftest-deps.mk
 727 }
 728 ])# _AM_OUTPUT_DEPENDENCY_COMMANDS
 729 
 730 
 731 # AM_OUTPUT_DEPENDENCY_COMMANDS
 732 # -----------------------------
 733 # This macro should only be invoked once -- use via AC_REQUIRE.
 734 #
 735 # This code is only required when automatic dependency tracking is enabled.
 736 # This creates each '.Po' and '.Plo' makefile fragment that we'll need in
 737 # order to bootstrap the dependency handling code.
 738 AC_DEFUN([AM_OUTPUT_DEPENDENCY_COMMANDS],
 739 [AC_CONFIG_COMMANDS([depfiles],
 740      [test x"$AMDEP_TRUE" != x"" || _AM_OUTPUT_DEPENDENCY_COMMANDS],
 741      [AMDEP_TRUE="$AMDEP_TRUE" MAKE="${MAKE-make}"])])
 742 
 743 # Do all the work for Automake.                             -*- Autoconf -*-
 744 
 745 # Copyright (C) 1996-2018 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
 746 #
 747 # This file is free software; the Free Software Foundation
 748 # gives unlimited permission to copy and/or distribute it,
 749 # with or without modifications, as long as this notice is preserved.
 750 
 751 # This macro actually does too much.  Some checks are only needed if
 752 # your package does certain things.  But this isn't really a big deal.
 753 
 754 dnl Redefine AC_PROG_CC to automatically invoke _AM_PROG_CC_C_O.
 755 m4_define([AC_PROG_CC],
 756 m4_defn([AC_PROG_CC])
 757 [_AM_PROG_CC_C_O
 758 ])

 760 # AM_INIT_AUTOMAKE(PACKAGE, VERSION, [NO-DEFINE])
 761 # AM_INIT_AUTOMAKE([OPTIONS])
 762 # -----------------------------------------------
 763 # The call with PACKAGE and VERSION arguments is the old style
 764 # call (pre autoconf-2.50), which is being phased out.  PACKAGE
 765 # and VERSION should now be passed to AC_INIT and removed from
 766 # the call to AM_INIT_AUTOMAKE.
 767 # We support both call styles for the transition.  After
 768 # the next Automake release, Autoconf can make the AC_INIT
 769 # arguments mandatory, and then we can depend on a new Autoconf
 770 # release and drop the old call support.
 771 AC_DEFUN([AM_INIT_AUTOMAKE],
 772 [AC_PREREQ([2.65])dnl
 773 dnl Autoconf wants to disallow AM_ names.  We explicitly allow
 774 dnl the ones we care about.
 775 m4_pattern_allow([^AM_[A-Z]+FLAGS$])dnl
 776 AC_REQUIRE([AM_SET_CURRENT_AUTOMAKE_VERSION])dnl
 777 AC_REQUIRE([AC_PROG_INSTALL])dnl
 778 if test "`cd $srcdir && pwd`" != "`pwd`"; then
 779   # Use -I$(srcdir) only when $(srcdir) != ., so that make's output
 780   # is not polluted with repeated "-I."
 781   AC_SUBST([am__isrc], [' -I$(srcdir)'])_AM_SUBST_NOTMAKE([am__isrc])dnl
 782   # test to see if srcdir already configured
 783   if test -f $srcdir/config.status; then
 784     AC_MSG_ERROR([source directory already configured; run "make distclean" there first])
 785   fi
 786 fi
 787 
 788 # test whether we have cygpath
 789 if test -z "$CYGPATH_W"; then
 790   if (cygpath --version) >/dev/null 2>/dev/null; then
 791     CYGPATH_W='cygpath -w'
 792   else
 793     CYGPATH_W=echo
 794   fi
 795 fi
 796 AC_SUBST([CYGPATH_W])
 797 
 798 # Define the identity of the package.
 799 dnl Distinguish between old-style and new-style calls.
 800 m4_ifval([$2],
 801 [AC_DIAGNOSE([obsolete],
 802              [$0: two- and three-arguments forms are deprecated.])
 803 m4_ifval([$3], [_AM_SET_OPTION([no-define])])dnl
 804  AC_SUBST([PACKAGE], [$1])dnl
 805  AC_SUBST([VERSION], [$2])],
 806 [_AM_SET_OPTIONS([$1])dnl
 807 dnl Diagnose old-style AC_INIT with new-style AM_AUTOMAKE_INIT.
 808 m4_if(
 809   m4_ifdef([AC_PACKAGE_NAME], [ok]):m4_ifdef([AC_PACKAGE_VERSION], [ok]),
 810   [ok:ok],,
 811   [m4_fatal([AC_INIT should be called with package and version arguments])])dnl
 812  AC_SUBST([PACKAGE], ['AC_PACKAGE_TARNAME'])dnl
 813  AC_SUBST([VERSION], ['AC_PACKAGE_VERSION'])])dnl
 814 
 815 _AM_IF_OPTION([no-define],,
 816 [AC_DEFINE_UNQUOTED([PACKAGE], ["$PACKAGE"], [Name of package])
 817  AC_DEFINE_UNQUOTED([VERSION], ["$VERSION"], [Version number of package])])dnl
 818 
 819 # Some tools Automake needs.
 820 AC_REQUIRE([AM_SANITY_CHECK])dnl
 821 AC_REQUIRE([AC_ARG_PROGRAM])dnl
 822 AM_MISSING_PROG([ACLOCAL], [aclocal-${am__api_version}])
 823 AM_MISSING_PROG([AUTOCONF], [autoconf])
 824 AM_MISSING_PROG([AUTOMAKE], [automake-${am__api_version}])
 825 AM_MISSING_PROG([AUTOHEADER], [autoheader])
 826 AM_MISSING_PROG([MAKEINFO], [makeinfo])
 827 AC_REQUIRE([AM_PROG_INSTALL_SH])dnl
 828 AC_REQUIRE([AM_PROG_INSTALL_STRIP])dnl
 829 AC_REQUIRE([AC_PROG_MKDIR_P])dnl
 830 # For better backward compatibility.  To be removed once Automake 1.9.x
 831 # dies out for good.  For more background, see:
 832 # <https://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/automake/2012-07/msg00001.html>
 833 # <https://lists.gnu.org/archive/html/automake/2012-07/msg00014.html>
 834 AC_SUBST([mkdir_p], ['$(MKDIR_P)'])
 835 # We need awk for the "check" target (and possibly the TAP driver).  The
 836 # system "awk" is bad on some platforms.
 837 AC_REQUIRE([AC_PROG_AWK])dnl
 838 AC_REQUIRE([AC_PROG_MAKE_SET])dnl
 839 AC_REQUIRE([AM_SET_LEADING_DOT])dnl
 840 _AM_IF_OPTION([tar-ustar], [_AM_PROG_TAR([ustar])],
 841 	      [_AM_IF_OPTION([tar-pax], [_AM_PROG_TAR([pax])],
 842 			     [_AM_PROG_TAR([v7])])])
 843 _AM_IF_OPTION([no-dependencies],,
 844 [AC_PROVIDE_IFELSE([AC_PROG_CC],
 845 		  [_AM_DEPENDENCIES([CC])],
 846 		  [m4_define([AC_PROG_CC],
 847 			     m4_defn([AC_PROG_CC])[_AM_DEPENDENCIES([CC])])])dnl
 848 AC_PROVIDE_IFELSE([AC_PROG_CXX],
 849 		  [_AM_DEPENDENCIES([CXX])],
 850 		  [m4_define([AC_PROG_CXX],
 851 			     m4_defn([AC_PROG_CXX])[_AM_DEPENDENCIES([CXX])])])dnl
 852 AC_PROVIDE_IFELSE([AC_PROG_OBJC],
 853 		  [_AM_DEPENDENCIES([OBJC])],
 854 		  [m4_define([AC_PROG_OBJC],
 855 			     m4_defn([AC_PROG_OBJC])[_AM_DEPENDENCIES([OBJC])])])dnl
 856 AC_PROVIDE_IFELSE([AC_PROG_OBJCXX],
 857 		  [_AM_DEPENDENCIES([OBJCXX])],
 858 		  [m4_define([AC_PROG_OBJCXX],
 859 			     m4_defn([AC_PROG_OBJCXX])[_AM_DEPENDENCIES([OBJCXX])])])dnl
 860 ])
 861 AC_REQUIRE([AM_SILENT_RULES])dnl
 862 dnl The testsuite driver may need to know about EXEEXT, so add the
 863 dnl 'am__EXEEXT' conditional if _AM_COMPILER_EXEEXT was seen.  This
 864 dnl macro is hooked onto _AC_COMPILER_EXEEXT early, see below.
 865 AC_CONFIG_COMMANDS_PRE(dnl
 866 [m4_provide_if([_AM_COMPILER_EXEEXT],
 867   [AM_CONDITIONAL([am__EXEEXT], [test -n "$EXEEXT"])])])dnl
 868 
 869 # POSIX will say in a future version that running "rm -f" with no argument
 870 # is OK; and we want to be able to make that assumption in our Makefile
 871 # recipes.  So use an aggressive probe to check that the usage we want is
 872 # actually supported "in the wild" to an acceptable degree.
 873 # See automake bug#10828.
 874 # To make any issue more visible, cause the running configure to be aborted
 875 # by default if the 'rm' program in use doesn't match our expectations; the
 876 # user can still override this though.
 877 if rm -f && rm -fr && rm -rf; then : OK; else
 878   cat >&2 <<'END'
 879 Oops!
 880 
 881 Your 'rm' program seems unable to run without file operands specified
 882 on the command line, even when the '-f' option is present.  This is contrary
 883 to the behaviour of most rm programs out there, and not conforming with
 884 the upcoming POSIX standard: <http://austingroupbugs.net/view.php?id=542>
 885 
 886 Please tell bug-automake@gnu.org about your system, including the value
 887 of your $PATH and any error possibly output before this message.  This
 888 can help us improve future automake versions.
 889 
 890 END
 891   if test x"$ACCEPT_INFERIOR_RM_PROGRAM" = x"yes"; then
 892     echo 'Configuration will proceed anyway, since you have set the' >&2
 893     echo 'ACCEPT_INFERIOR_RM_PROGRAM variable to "yes"' >&2
 894     echo >&2
 895   else
 896     cat >&2 <<'END'
 897 Aborting the configuration process, to ensure you take notice of the issue.
 898 
 899 You can download and install GNU coreutils to get an 'rm' implementation
 900 that behaves properly: <https://www.gnu.org/software/coreutils/>.
 901 
 902 If you want to complete the configuration process using your problematic
 903 'rm' anyway, export the environment variable ACCEPT_INFERIOR_RM_PROGRAM
 904 to "yes", and re-run configure.
 905 
 906 END
 907     AC_MSG_ERROR([Your 'rm' program is bad, sorry.])
 908   fi
 909 fi
 910 dnl The trailing newline in this macro's definition is deliberate, for
 911 dnl backward compatibility and to allow trailing 'dnl'-style comments
 912 dnl after the AM_INIT_AUTOMAKE invocation. See automake bug#16841.
 913 ])
 914 
 915 dnl Hook into '_AC_COMPILER_EXEEXT' early to learn its expansion.  Do not
 916 dnl add the conditional right here, as _AC_COMPILER_EXEEXT may be further
 917 dnl mangled by Autoconf and run in a shell conditional statement.
 918 m4_define([_AC_COMPILER_EXEEXT],
 919 m4_defn([_AC_COMPILER_EXEEXT])[m4_provide([_AM_COMPILER_EXEEXT])])
 920 
 921 # When config.status generates a header, we must update the stamp-h file.
 922 # This file resides in the same directory as the config header
 923 # that is generated.  The stamp files are numbered to have different names.
 924 
 925 # Autoconf calls _AC_AM_CONFIG_HEADER_HOOK (when defined) in the
 926 # loop where config.status creates the headers, so we can generate
 927 # our stamp files there.
 928 AC_DEFUN([_AC_AM_CONFIG_HEADER_HOOK],
 929 [# Compute $1's index in $config_headers.
 930 _am_arg=$1
 931 _am_stamp_count=1
 932 for _am_header in $config_headers :; do
 933   case $_am_header in
 934     $_am_arg | $_am_arg:* )
 935       break ;;
 936     * )
 937       _am_stamp_count=`expr $_am_stamp_count + 1` ;;
 938   esac
 939 done
 940 echo "timestamp for $_am_arg" >`AS_DIRNAME(["$_am_arg"])`/stamp-h[]$_am_stamp_count])
 941 
 942 # Copyright (C) 2001-2018 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
 943 #
 944 # This file is free software; the Free Software Foundation
 945 # gives unlimited permission to copy and/or distribute it,
 946 # with or without modifications, as long as this notice is preserved.
 947 
 948 # AM_PROG_INSTALL_SH
 949 # ------------------
 950 # Define $install_sh.
 951 AC_DEFUN([AM_PROG_INSTALL_SH],
 952 [AC_REQUIRE([AM_AUX_DIR_EXPAND])dnl
 953 if test x"${install_sh+set}" != xset; then
 954   case $am_aux_dir in
 955   *\ * | *\	*)
 956     install_sh="\${SHELL} '$am_aux_dir/install-sh'" ;;
 957   *)
 958     install_sh="\${SHELL} $am_aux_dir/install-sh"
 959   esac
 960 fi
 961 AC_SUBST([install_sh])])

 963 # Copyright (C) 2003-2018 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
 964 #
 965 # This file is free software; the Free Software Foundation
 966 # gives unlimited permission to copy and/or distribute it,
 967 # with or without modifications, as long as this notice is preserved.

 969 # Check whether the underlying file-system supports filenames
 970 # with a leading dot.  For instance MS-DOS doesn't.
 971 AC_DEFUN([AM_SET_LEADING_DOT],
 972 [rm -rf .tst 2>/dev/null
 973 mkdir .tst 2>/dev/null
 974 if test -d .tst; then
 975   am__leading_dot=.
 976 else
 977   am__leading_dot=_
 978 fi
 979 rmdir .tst 2>/dev/null
 980 AC_SUBST([am__leading_dot])])

 982 # Add --enable-maintainer-mode option to configure.         -*- Autoconf -*-
 983 # From Jim Meyering
 984 
 985 # Copyright (C) 1996-2018 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
 986 #
 987 # This file is free software; the Free Software Foundation
 988 # gives unlimited permission to copy and/or distribute it,
 989 # with or without modifications, as long as this notice is preserved.
 990 
 991 # AM_MAINTAINER_MODE([DEFAULT-MODE])
 992 # ----------------------------------
 993 # Control maintainer-specific portions of Makefiles.
 994 # Default is to disable them, unless 'enable' is passed literally.
 995 # For symmetry, 'disable' may be passed as well.  Anyway, the user
 996 # can override the default with the --enable/--disable switch.
 997 AC_DEFUN([AM_MAINTAINER_MODE],
 998 [m4_case(m4_default([$1], [disable]),
 999        [enable], [m4_define([am_maintainer_other], [disable])],
1000        [disable], [m4_define([am_maintainer_other], [enable])],
1001        [m4_define([am_maintainer_other], [enable])
1002         m4_warn([syntax], [unexpected argument to AM@&t@_MAINTAINER_MODE: $1])])
1003 AC_MSG_CHECKING([whether to enable maintainer-specific portions of Makefiles])
1004   dnl maintainer-mode's default is 'disable' unless 'enable' is passed
1005   AC_ARG_ENABLE([maintainer-mode],
1006     [AS_HELP_STRING([--]am_maintainer_other[-maintainer-mode],
1007       am_maintainer_other[ make rules and dependencies not useful
1008       (and sometimes confusing) to the casual installer])],
1009     [USE_MAINTAINER_MODE=$enableval],
1010     [USE_MAINTAINER_MODE=]m4_if(am_maintainer_other, [enable], [no], [yes]))
1011   AC_MSG_RESULT([$USE_MAINTAINER_MODE])
1012   AM_CONDITIONAL([MAINTAINER_MODE], [test $USE_MAINTAINER_MODE = yes])
1013   MAINT=$MAINTAINER_MODE_TRUE
1014   AC_SUBST([MAINT])dnl
1015 ]
1016 )
1017 
1018 # Check to see how 'make' treats includes.	            -*- Autoconf -*-
1019 
1020 # Copyright (C) 2001-2018 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
1021 #
1022 # This file is free software; the Free Software Foundation
1023 # gives unlimited permission to copy and/or distribute it,
1024 # with or without modifications, as long as this notice is preserved.
1025 
1026 # AM_MAKE_INCLUDE()
1027 # -----------------
1028 # Check whether make has an 'include' directive that can support all
1029 # the idioms we need for our automatic dependency tracking code.
1030 AC_DEFUN([AM_MAKE_INCLUDE],
1031 [AC_MSG_CHECKING([whether ${MAKE-make} supports the include directive])
1032 cat > confinc.mk << 'END'
1033 am__doit:
1034 	@echo this is the am__doit target >confinc.out
1035 .PHONY: am__doit
1036 END
1037 am__include="#"
1038 am__quote=
1039 # BSD make does it like this.
1040 echo '.include "confinc.mk" # ignored' > confmf.BSD
1041 # Other make implementations (GNU, Solaris 10, AIX) do it like this.
1042 echo 'include confinc.mk # ignored' > confmf.GNU
1043 _am_result=no
1044 for s in GNU BSD; do
1045   AM_RUN_LOG([${MAKE-make} -f confmf.$s && cat confinc.out])
1046   AS_CASE([$?:`cat confinc.out 2>/dev/null`],
1047       ['0:this is the am__doit target'],
1048       [AS_CASE([$s],
1049           [BSD], [am__include='.include' am__quote='"'],
1050           [am__include='include' am__quote=''])])
1051   if test "$am__include" != "#"; then
1052     _am_result="yes ($s style)"
1053     break
1054   fi
1055 done
1056 rm -f confinc.* confmf.*
1057 AC_MSG_RESULT([${_am_result}])
1058 AC_SUBST([am__include])])
1059 AC_SUBST([am__quote])])
1060 
1061 # Fake the existence of programs that GNU maintainers use.  -*- Autoconf -*-
1062 
1063 # Copyright (C) 1997-2018 Free Software Foundation, Inc.

1065 # This file is free software; the Free Software Foundation
1066 # gives unlimited permission to copy and/or distribute it,
1067 # with or without modifications, as long as this notice is preserved.

1069 # AM_MISSING_PROG(NAME, PROGRAM)
1070 # ------------------------------
1071 AC_DEFUN([AM_MISSING_PROG],
1072 [AC_REQUIRE([AM_MISSING_HAS_RUN])
1073 $1=${$1-"${am_missing_run}$2"}
1074 AC_SUBST($1)])
1075 
1076 # AM_MISSING_HAS_RUN
1077 # ------------------
1078 # Define MISSING if not defined so far and test if it is modern enough.
1079 # If it is, set am_missing_run to use it, otherwise, to nothing.
1080 AC_DEFUN([AM_MISSING_HAS_RUN],
1081 [AC_REQUIRE([AM_AUX_DIR_EXPAND])dnl
1082 AC_REQUIRE_AUX_FILE([missing])dnl
1083 if test x"${MISSING+set}" != xset; then
1084   case $am_aux_dir in
1085   *\ * | *\	*)
1086     MISSING="\${SHELL} \"$am_aux_dir/missing\"" ;;
1087   *)
1088     MISSING="\${SHELL} $am_aux_dir/missing" ;;
1089   esac
1090 fi
1091 # Use eval to expand $SHELL
1092 if eval "$MISSING --is-lightweight"; then
1093   am_missing_run="$MISSING "
1094 else
1095   am_missing_run=
1096   AC_MSG_WARN(['missing' script is too old or missing])
1097 fi
1098 ])

1108 # _AM_MANGLE_OPTION(NAME)
1109 # -----------------------
1110 AC_DEFUN([_AM_MANGLE_OPTION],
1111 [[_AM_OPTION_]m4_bpatsubst($1, [[^a-zA-Z0-9_]], [_])])
1112 
1113 # _AM_SET_OPTION(NAME)
1114 # --------------------
1115 # Set option NAME.  Presently that only means defining a flag for this option.
1116 AC_DEFUN([_AM_SET_OPTION],
1117 [m4_define(_AM_MANGLE_OPTION([$1]), [1])])

1119 # _AM_SET_OPTIONS(OPTIONS)
1120 # ------------------------
1121 # OPTIONS is a space-separated list of Automake options.
1122 AC_DEFUN([_AM_SET_OPTIONS],
1123 [m4_foreach_w([_AM_Option], [$1], [_AM_SET_OPTION(_AM_Option)])])
1124 
1125 # _AM_IF_OPTION(OPTION, IF-SET, [IF-NOT-SET])
1126 # -------------------------------------------
1127 # Execute IF-SET if OPTION is set, IF-NOT-SET otherwise.
1128 AC_DEFUN([_AM_IF_OPTION],
1129 [m4_ifset(_AM_MANGLE_OPTION([$1]), [$2], [$3])])

1131 # Copyright (C) 1999-2018 Free Software Foundation, Inc.

1137 # _AM_PROG_CC_C_O
1138 # ---------------
1139 # Like AC_PROG_CC_C_O, but changed for automake.  We rewrite AC_PROG_CC
1140 # to automatically call this.
1141 AC_DEFUN([_AM_PROG_CC_C_O],
1142 [AC_REQUIRE([AM_AUX_DIR_EXPAND])dnl
1143 AC_REQUIRE_AUX_FILE([compile])dnl
1144 AC_LANG_PUSH([C])dnl
1145 AC_CACHE_CHECK(
1146   [whether $CC understands -c and -o together],
1147   [am_cv_prog_cc_c_o],
1148   [AC_LANG_CONFTEST([AC_LANG_PROGRAM([])])
1149   # Make sure it works both with $CC and with simple cc.
1150   # Following AC_PROG_CC_C_O, we do the test twice because some
1151   # compilers refuse to overwrite an existing .o file with -o,
1152   # though they will create one.
1153   am_cv_prog_cc_c_o=yes
1154   for am_i in 1 2; do
1155     if AM_RUN_LOG([$CC -c conftest.$ac_ext -o conftest2.$ac_objext]) \
1156          && test -f conftest2.$ac_objext; then
1157       : OK
1158     else
1159       am_cv_prog_cc_c_o=no
1160       break
1161     fi
1162   done
1163   rm -f core conftest*
1164   unset am_i])
1165 if test "$am_cv_prog_cc_c_o" != yes; then
1166    # Losing compiler, so override with the script.
1167    # FIXME: It is wrong to rewrite CC.
1168    # But if we don't then we get into trouble of one sort or another.
1169    # A longer-term fix would be to have automake use am__CC in this case,
1170    # and then we could set am__CC="\$(top_srcdir)/compile \$(CC)"
1171    CC="$am_aux_dir/compile $CC"
1172 fi
1173 AC_LANG_POP([C])])
1174 
1175 # For backward compatibility.
1176 AC_DEFUN_ONCE([AM_PROG_CC_C_O], [AC_REQUIRE([AC_PROG_CC])])
1177 
1178 # Copyright (C) 2001-2018 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
1179 #
1180 # This file is free software; the Free Software Foundation
1181 # gives unlimited permission to copy and/or distribute it,
1182 # with or without modifications, as long as this notice is preserved.
1183 
1184 # AM_RUN_LOG(COMMAND)
1185 # -------------------
1186 # Run COMMAND, save the exit status in ac_status, and log it.
1187 # (This has been adapted from Autoconf's _AC_RUN_LOG macro.)
1188 AC_DEFUN([AM_RUN_LOG],
1189 [{ echo "$as_me:$LINENO: $1" >&AS_MESSAGE_LOG_FD
1190    ($1) >&AS_MESSAGE_LOG_FD 2>&AS_MESSAGE_LOG_FD
1191    ac_status=$?
1192    echo "$as_me:$LINENO: \$? = $ac_status" >&AS_MESSAGE_LOG_FD
1193    (exit $ac_status); }])
1194 
1195 # Check to make sure that the build environment is sane.    -*- Autoconf -*-
1196 
1197 # Copyright (C) 1996-2018 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
1198 #
1199 # This file is free software; the Free Software Foundation
1200 # gives unlimited permission to copy and/or distribute it,
1201 # with or without modifications, as long as this notice is preserved.
1202 
1203 # AM_SANITY_CHECK
1204 # ---------------
1205 AC_DEFUN([AM_SANITY_CHECK],
1206 [AC_MSG_CHECKING([whether build environment is sane])
1207 # Reject unsafe characters in $srcdir or the absolute working directory
1208 # name.  Accept space and tab only in the latter.
1209 am_lf='
1210 '
1211 case `pwd` in
1212   *[[\\\"\#\$\&\'\`$am_lf]]*)
1213     AC_MSG_ERROR([unsafe absolute working directory name]);;
1214 esac
1215 case $srcdir in
1216   *[[\\\"\#\$\&\'\`$am_lf\ \	]]*)
1217     AC_MSG_ERROR([unsafe srcdir value: '$srcdir']);;
1218 esac
1219 
1220 # Do 'set' in a subshell so we don't clobber the current shell's
1221 # arguments.  Must try -L first in case configure is actually a
1222 # symlink; some systems play weird games with the mod time of symlinks
1223 # (eg FreeBSD returns the mod time of the symlink's containing
1224 # directory).
1225 if (
1226    am_has_slept=no
1227    for am_try in 1 2; do
1228      echo "timestamp, slept: $am_has_slept" > conftest.file
1229      set X `ls -Lt "$srcdir/configure" conftest.file 2> /dev/null`
1230      if test "$[*]" = "X"; then
1231 	# -L didn't work.
1232 	set X `ls -t "$srcdir/configure" conftest.file`
1233      fi
1234      if test "$[*]" != "X $srcdir/configure conftest.file" \
1235 	&& test "$[*]" != "X conftest.file $srcdir/configure"; then
1236 
1237 	# If neither matched, then we have a broken ls.  This can happen
1238 	# if, for instance, CONFIG_SHELL is bash and it inherits a
1239 	# broken ls alias from the environment.  This has actually
1240 	# happened.  Such a system could not be considered "sane".
1241 	AC_MSG_ERROR([ls -t appears to fail.  Make sure there is not a broken
1242   alias in your environment])
1243      fi
1244      if test "$[2]" = conftest.file || test $am_try -eq 2; then
1245        break
1246      fi
1247      # Just in case.
1248      sleep 1
1249      am_has_slept=yes
1250    done
1251    test "$[2]" = conftest.file
1252    )
1253 then
1254    # Ok.
1255    :
1256 else
1257    AC_MSG_ERROR([newly created file is older than distributed files!
1258 Check your system clock])
1259 fi
1260 AC_MSG_RESULT([yes])
1261 # If we didn't sleep, we still need to ensure time stamps of config.status and
1262 # generated files are strictly newer.
1263 am_sleep_pid=
1264 if grep 'slept: no' conftest.file >/dev/null 2>&1; then
1265   ( sleep 1 ) &
1266   am_sleep_pid=$!
1267 fi
1268 AC_CONFIG_COMMANDS_PRE(
1269   [AC_MSG_CHECKING([that generated files are newer than configure])
1270    if test -n "$am_sleep_pid"; then
1271      # Hide warnings about reused PIDs.
1272      wait $am_sleep_pid 2>/dev/null
1273    fi
1274    AC_MSG_RESULT([done])])
1275 rm -f conftest.file
1276 ])
1277 
1278 # Copyright (C) 2009-2018 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
1279 #
1280 # This file is free software; the Free Software Foundation
1281 # gives unlimited permission to copy and/or distribute it,
1282 # with or without modifications, as long as this notice is preserved.
1283 
1284 # AM_SILENT_RULES([DEFAULT])
1285 # --------------------------
1286 # Enable less verbose build rules; with the default set to DEFAULT
1287 # ("yes" being less verbose, "no" or empty being verbose).
1288 AC_DEFUN([AM_SILENT_RULES],
1289 [AC_ARG_ENABLE([silent-rules], [dnl
1290 AS_HELP_STRING(
1291   [--enable-silent-rules],
1292   [less verbose build output (undo: "make V=1")])
1293 AS_HELP_STRING(
1294   [--disable-silent-rules],
1295   [verbose build output (undo: "make V=0")])dnl
1296 ])
1297 case $enable_silent_rules in @%:@ (((
1298   yes) AM_DEFAULT_VERBOSITY=0;;
1299    no) AM_DEFAULT_VERBOSITY=1;;
1300     *) AM_DEFAULT_VERBOSITY=m4_if([$1], [yes], [0], [1]);;
1301 esac
1302 dnl
1303 dnl A few 'make' implementations (e.g., NonStop OS and NextStep)
1304 dnl do not support nested variable expansions.
1305 dnl See automake bug#9928 and bug#10237.
1306 am_make=${MAKE-make}
1307 AC_CACHE_CHECK([whether $am_make supports nested variables],
1308    [am_cv_make_support_nested_variables],
1309    [if AS_ECHO([['TRUE=$(BAR$(V))
1310 BAR0=false
1311 BAR1=true
1312 V=1
1313 am__doit:
1314 	@$(TRUE)
1315 .PHONY: am__doit']]) | $am_make -f - >/dev/null 2>&1; then
1316   am_cv_make_support_nested_variables=yes
1317 else
1318   am_cv_make_support_nested_variables=no
1319 fi])
1320 if test $am_cv_make_support_nested_variables = yes; then
1321   dnl Using '$V' instead of '$(V)' breaks IRIX make.
1322   AM_V='$(V)'
1323   AM_DEFAULT_V='$(AM_DEFAULT_VERBOSITY)'
1324 else
1325   AM_V=$AM_DEFAULT_VERBOSITY
1326   AM_DEFAULT_V=$AM_DEFAULT_VERBOSITY
1327 fi
1328 AC_SUBST([AM_V])dnl
1329 AM_SUBST_NOTMAKE([AM_V])dnl
1330 AC_SUBST([AM_DEFAULT_V])dnl
1331 AM_SUBST_NOTMAKE([AM_DEFAULT_V])dnl
1332 AC_SUBST([AM_DEFAULT_VERBOSITY])dnl
1333 AM_BACKSLASH='\'
1334 AC_SUBST([AM_BACKSLASH])dnl
1335 _AM_SUBST_NOTMAKE([AM_BACKSLASH])dnl
1336 ])
1337 
1338 # Copyright (C) 2001-2018 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
1339 #
1340 # This file is free software; the Free Software Foundation
1341 # gives unlimited permission to copy and/or distribute it,
1342 # with or without modifications, as long as this notice is preserved.
1343 
1344 # AM_PROG_INSTALL_STRIP
1345 # ---------------------
1346 # One issue with vendor 'install' (even GNU) is that you can't
1347 # specify the program used to strip binaries.  This is especially
1348 # annoying in cross-compiling environments, where the build's strip
1349 # is unlikely to handle the host's binaries.
1350 # Fortunately install-sh will honor a STRIPPROG variable, so we
1351 # always use install-sh in "make install-strip", and initialize
1352 # STRIPPROG with the value of the STRIP variable (set by the user).
1353 AC_DEFUN([AM_PROG_INSTALL_STRIP],
1354 [AC_REQUIRE([AM_PROG_INSTALL_SH])dnl
1355 # Installed binaries are usually stripped using 'strip' when the user
1356 # run "make install-strip".  However 'strip' might not be the right
1357 # tool to use in cross-compilation environments, therefore Automake
1358 # will honor the 'STRIP' environment variable to overrule this program.
1359 dnl Don't test for $cross_compiling = yes, because it might be 'maybe'.
1360 if test "$cross_compiling" != no; then
1361   AC_CHECK_TOOL([STRIP], [strip], :)
1362 fi
1363 INSTALL_STRIP_PROGRAM="\$(install_sh) -c -s"
1364 AC_SUBST([INSTALL_STRIP_PROGRAM])])
1365 
1366 # Copyright (C) 2006-2018 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
1367 #
1368 # This file is free software; the Free Software Foundation
1369 # gives unlimited permission to copy and/or distribute it,
1370 # with or without modifications, as long as this notice is preserved.
1371 
1372 # _AM_SUBST_NOTMAKE(VARIABLE)
1373 # ---------------------------
1374 # Prevent Automake from outputting VARIABLE = @VARIABLE@ in Makefile.in.
1375 # This macro is traced by Automake.
1376 AC_DEFUN([_AM_SUBST_NOTMAKE])
1377 
1378 # AM_SUBST_NOTMAKE(VARIABLE)
1379 # --------------------------
1380 # Public sister of _AM_SUBST_NOTMAKE.
1381 AC_DEFUN([AM_SUBST_NOTMAKE], [_AM_SUBST_NOTMAKE($@)])

1383 # Check how to create a tarball.                            -*- Autoconf -*-
1384 
1385 # Copyright (C) 2004-2018 Free Software Foundation, Inc.
1386 #
1387 # This file is free software; the Free Software Foundation
1388 # gives unlimited permission to copy and/or distribute it,
1389 # with or without modifications, as long as this notice is preserved.
1390 
1391 # _AM_PROG_TAR(FORMAT)
1392 # --------------------
1393 # Check how to create a tarball in format FORMAT.
1394 # FORMAT should be one of 'v7', 'ustar', or 'pax'.
1395 #
1396 # Substitute a variable $(am__tar) that is a command
1397 # writing to stdout a FORMAT-tarball containing the directory
1398 # $tardir.
1399 #     tardir=directory && $(am__tar) > result.tar
1400 #
1401 # Substitute a variable $(am__untar) that extract such
1402 # a tarball read from stdin.
1403 #     $(am__untar) < result.tar
1404 #
1405 AC_DEFUN([_AM_PROG_TAR],
1406 [# Always define AMTAR for backward compatibility.  Yes, it's still used
1407 # in the wild :-(  We should find a proper way to deprecate it ...
1408 AC_SUBST([AMTAR], ['$${TAR-tar}'])
1409 
1410 # We'll loop over all known methods to create a tar archive until one works.
1411 _am_tools='gnutar m4_if([$1], [ustar], [plaintar]) pax cpio none'
1412 
1413 m4_if([$1], [v7],
1414   [am__tar='$${TAR-tar} chof - "$$tardir"' am__untar='$${TAR-tar} xf -'],
1415 
1416   [m4_case([$1],
1417     [ustar],
1418      [# The POSIX 1988 'ustar' format is defined with fixed-size fields.
1419       # There is notably a 21 bits limit for the UID and the GID.  In fact,
1420       # the 'pax' utility can hang on bigger UID/GID (see automake bug#8343
1421       # and bug#13588).
1422       am_max_uid=2097151 # 2^21 - 1
1423       am_max_gid=$am_max_uid
1424       # The $UID and $GID variables are not portable, so we need to resort
1425       # to the POSIX-mandated id(1) utility.  Errors in the 'id' calls
1426       # below are definitely unexpected, so allow the users to see them
1427       # (that is, avoid stderr redirection).
1428       am_uid=`id -u || echo unknown`
1429       am_gid=`id -g || echo unknown`
1430       AC_MSG_CHECKING([whether UID '$am_uid' is supported by ustar format])
1431       if test $am_uid -le $am_max_uid; then
1432          AC_MSG_RESULT([yes])
1433       else
1434          AC_MSG_RESULT([no])
1435          _am_tools=none
1436       fi
1437       AC_MSG_CHECKING([whether GID '$am_gid' is supported by ustar format])
1438       if test $am_gid -le $am_max_gid; then
1439          AC_MSG_RESULT([yes])
1440       else
1441         AC_MSG_RESULT([no])
1442         _am_tools=none
1443       fi],
1444 
1445   [pax],
1446     [],
1447 
1448   [m4_fatal([Unknown tar format])])
1449 
1450   AC_MSG_CHECKING([how to create a $1 tar archive])
1451 
1452   # Go ahead even if we have the value already cached.  We do so because we
1453   # need to set the values for the 'am__tar' and 'am__untar' variables.
1454   _am_tools=${am_cv_prog_tar_$1-$_am_tools}
1455 
1456   for _am_tool in $_am_tools; do
1457     case $_am_tool in
1458     gnutar)
1459       for _am_tar in tar gnutar gtar; do
1460         AM_RUN_LOG([$_am_tar --version]) && break
1461       done
1462       am__tar="$_am_tar --format=m4_if([$1], [pax], [posix], [$1]) -chf - "'"$$tardir"'
1463       am__tar_="$_am_tar --format=m4_if([$1], [pax], [posix], [$1]) -chf - "'"$tardir"'
1464       am__untar="$_am_tar -xf -"
1465       ;;
1466     plaintar)
1467       # Must skip GNU tar: if it does not support --format= it doesn't create
1468       # ustar tarball either.
1469       (tar --version) >/dev/null 2>&1 && continue
1470       am__tar='tar chf - "$$tardir"'
1471       am__tar_='tar chf - "$tardir"'
1472       am__untar='tar xf -'
1473       ;;
1474     pax)
1475       am__tar='pax -L -x $1 -w "$$tardir"'
1476       am__tar_='pax -L -x $1 -w "$tardir"'
1477       am__untar='pax -r'
1478       ;;
1479     cpio)
1480       am__tar='find "$$tardir" -print | cpio -o -H $1 -L'
1481       am__tar_='find "$tardir" -print | cpio -o -H $1 -L'
1482       am__untar='cpio -i -H $1 -d'
1483       ;;
1484     none)
1485       am__tar=false
1486       am__tar_=false
1487       am__untar=false
1488       ;;
1489     esac
1490 
1491     # If the value was cached, stop now.  We just wanted to have am__tar
1492     # and am__untar set.
1493     test -n "${am_cv_prog_tar_$1}" && break
1494 
1495     # tar/untar a dummy directory, and stop if the command works.
1496     rm -rf conftest.dir
1497     mkdir conftest.dir
1498     echo GrepMe > conftest.dir/file
1499     AM_RUN_LOG([tardir=conftest.dir && eval $am__tar_ >conftest.tar])
1500     rm -rf conftest.dir
1501     if test -s conftest.tar; then
1502       AM_RUN_LOG([$am__untar <conftest.tar])
1503       AM_RUN_LOG([cat conftest.dir/file])
1504       grep GrepMe conftest.dir/file >/dev/null 2>&1 && break
1505     fi
1506   done
1507   rm -rf conftest.dir
1508 
1509   AC_CACHE_VAL([am_cv_prog_tar_$1], [am_cv_prog_tar_$1=$_am_tool])
1510   AC_MSG_RESULT([$am_cv_prog_tar_$1])])
1511 
1512 AC_SUBST([am__tar])
1513 AC_SUBST([am__untar])
1514 ]) # _AM_PROG_TAR
1515 
1516 m4_include([m4/libtool.m4])
1517 m4_include([m4/ltoptions.m4])
1518 m4_include([m4/ltsugar.m4])
1519 m4_include([m4/ltversion.m4])
1520 m4_include([m4/lt~obsolete.m4])
1521 m4_include([acinclude.m4])
